Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2008 07:47AM calimom wrote: My mom is 62 and was diagnosed in August 2007 with stage 2 breast cancer.  I'm 38 (mother of 2) and just had a mamo & ultrasound done last month.  My doctor did not find anything during my breast exam but ordered the mamo/ultrasound for my peace of mind.  She ordered both in order to compare them.  I'm glad that she did because the ultrasound found a couple of areas of concern.  I'm seeing a surgeon next month to see if they can remove the growth and have them tested.  If my doctor hadn't ordered the tests, God only knows what would have happened if she waited 2 more years to order a regular mamo.  You're never too young to have one.  Just keep pressuring your Dr. into doing it or switch to someone who will.  God Bless you & your mom.
Posts.Title: when should i have my first mamogram? myhueandcry jezza
